conclusion: Determine how objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves backward, above the objects.
Object A is located on the ground.
Object B is on the ground.
Object C is on the ground.
Object D is on the ground.
The light source is moving backward, above the objects.
The light source will move downward, casting shadows on the ground.
The objects will move downward, casting shadows on the ground.
The size of the objects will remain the same, as they are not affected by the movement of the light source.
Position of Object A: On the ground.
Size of Object A will remain the same.
Position of Object B: On the ground.
Size of Object B will remain the same.
Position of Object C: On the ground.
Size of Object C will remain the same.
Position of Object D: On the ground.
Size of Object D will remain the same.
When the light source moves backward, above the objects, the objects will move downward, casting shadows on the ground. The size of the objects will remain the same.
